content.description: Start right of arete at base of small slab. Climb up and left on slab until rock becomes vertical, then reach for good holds at lip and mantel to topout.
The crux is the start and its a nice long traverse for beginners
content.location: On the long side of Best Kept Secret

content.description: Start squatting with hands matched on flake in crack. Move up and left to hrizontal shelf, then up and right to a hidden pocket at lip. Crux is manteling to topout.

Start sitting with a good undercling approximately 4 feet right of the seam/crack on the far right side of the wall.  Climb up using crimps always staying right of the crack (crack holds are off-route).  Very tempting to move left to the crack but for full value topout right of the crack.
content.location: Right most problem on the wall.  #3 in the beta photo.

content.description: The crux are the crimps and the top out. Its a really nice climb but really short.
content.location: The route is located on Best Kept Secret which is right next to site #25. It is just past the tree, next to the vertical crack.

content.description: Climb the face just left of the big crack.
Climb the arête that is the left side of the big crack.

Start sitting matched on the sharp flake just above the low roof (left hand starting hold for Special Op). Move up to the obvious twin pockets then climb straight up and over the rounded top. All holds in the crack to the right are off. Sounds squeezed but climbs independently of the crack.
content.location: Directly in front of tree to the right of the wide break in the wall and left of the seam/crack (Special Op).

content.description: Start at the base of "V1 Traverse" and traverse all the way left around the arete and top out "Immaculate Arete" crux is probably the topout.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter, topout is mildly sketchy.
content.location: Big left-leaning crack in the face, ride that as long as you want (top is off), then come off the crack and stay halfway up the face until you reach around the arete.

content.description: Start standing at the base of the arete. Pull on, reach high with your right hand, get your feet up and go for good hold at top. Finish on easy jugs. One of the coolest problems at it's grade in the park.  Can be done from a sit start at a grade or two harder.
content.location: Obvious arête, #3 on the beta photo

content.description: Start as for Trouble Ahead, but climb up and right, following crack to top of boulder. the boulder.
Climb the central portion of the steeper face.
Sit start on an edge near the bottom left of this small boulder, work straight up through a couple positive crimps up to a mantle topout.
content.location: This problem is on the right of the Best Kept Secret Boulder, adjacent to the Best Kept Slab problem.

content.description: Stand start with left hand on undercling and right hand on the blank arete, step on and quest up the relatively blank low angle slab to an easy topout. Can be made harder by avoiding the good jugs deeper in the crack to the right.
content.location: Right side of the Best Kept Secret Wall, right of the tree on the higher tier.

content.description: Start same as for Warmup but climb up and right to steeper rock. Follow several large jugs to lip and easy mantel topout.
It is right near sites 25 and 26 on the map. The spot itself is pretty shady. Known earlier by the Rhodey Loadies as Lost Town.
